name: cerbos
description: Cerbos is a self-hosted authorization layer that decouples permissions from application code. It supports policy-as-code via YAML, and can be embedded in microservices, securing APIs and internal apps.
features: Authorization Layer: Decouple permissions from application code. Clean architecture.
Policy-as-Code: Define permissions in YAML files. Version controlled.
Microservices Ready: Embed in any service or API. Flexible deployment.
Fine-Grained Control: Detailed permission rules and conditions. Precise access.
API Security: Protect APIs with centralized authorization. Consistent security.
Developer-Friendly: Easy integration with existing apps. Minimal friction.
Self-Hosted: Run authorization on your infrastructure. Complete control.
